alert.note: Alert for Clark; Hot Spring (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 17 at 11:09AM CDT until April 19 at 12:38PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Arkansas... Ouachita River At Arkadelphia affecting Hot Spring and Clark Counties. Ouachita River At Camden affecting Ouachita and Calhoun Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Arkansas... Ouachita River At Thatcher L&D affecting Bradley, Union and Calhoun Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ouachita River At Arkadelphia. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, State Highway 7 and 51 railroad underpass flooded. Fields and timber along the river flooded. At 21.0 feet, State Highway 7 and 51 east of Arkadelphia flooded. Railroad underpass closed. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 20.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is currently cresting and will fall below flood stage by tomorrow morning, April 18. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecast 1 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Crest Time Date Ouachita River Arkadelphia 17.0 20.2 Sun 10 AM 15.5 11.4 10.4 CRESTING &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
